verbose_text: We observed that C7G6-IgM, C3G10-IgM, C11B10 and C10H10-IgG antibodies inhibited lysis of Victoria lineage virus infected RBCs to varying degrees, indicating that a portion of viral particles were prevented from fusing with RBC membranes, but that none of these antibodies inhibited lysis of RBCs infected with Yamagata lineage virus, whereas the positive control antibody C12G6 was able to inhibit the lysis of cells infected with either virus lineage.
evidence: C3G10-IgM, C11B10 and C10H10-IgG antibodies inhibited lysis of Victoria lineage virus-infected RBCs to varying degrees, indicating that a portion of viral particles were prevented from fusing with RBC membranes, but that none of these antibodies inhibited lysis of RBCs
